title: Google Sheets Basics
description: Learn the fundamentals of Google Sheets - basic formulas, formatting, and organizing data

challenges.title: Your First Spreadsheet
challenges.description: Create a simple spreadsheet and learn basic data entry
challenges.instructions: Ask the user to create a simple shopping list with three columns: Item Name, Quantity, and Price. They should enter at least 5 items. Guide them through entering data, formatting headers (bold text), and basic cell selection.
challenges.validation: Check for: At least 5 rows of data, three columns (Item, Quantity, Price), bold headers, and properly aligned data (text left, numbers right).
hints: Click on a cell to select it and start typing
Press Tab to move to the next cell or Enter to move down
Select the header row and click the Bold button to make it stand out
Numbers automatically align to the right

challenges.title: Basic Math with SUM
challenges.description: Learn to add numbers using the SUM formula
challenges.instructions: Using their shopping list, challenge the user to calculate the total cost. They should create a 'Total' column that multiplies Quantity by Price for each item, then use SUM to add up all the totals. This introduces basic formulas like =B2*C2 and =SUM(D2:D6).
challenges.validation: Verify: Total column with multiplication formulas (=Quantity*Price), a SUM formula at the bottom calculating the grand total, and correct results.
hints: To multiply, type =B2*C2 (Quantity times Price)
Click and drag the formula down to copy it to other rows
Use =SUM(D2:D6) to add up all totals (adjust range as needed)
Formulas always start with an equals sign =

challenges.title: AVERAGE and COUNT Functions
challenges.description: Learn to calculate averages and count items
challenges.instructions: Ask the user to add summary statistics below their shopping list: total number of items (using COUNT), and average price per item (using AVERAGE). They should label these calculations clearly.
challenges.validation: Confirm: COUNT formula counting the number of items, AVERAGE formula calculating average price, proper labels for each calculation.
hints: Use =COUNT(A2:A6) to count how many items you have
Use =AVERAGE(C2:C6) to find the average price
Add labels in the cell to the left like 'Number of Items:'
Make sure your range includes all your data

challenges.title: Simple IF Statement
challenges.description: Use IF statements to make decisions in your spreadsheet
challenges.instructions: Challenge the user to add a 'Status' column that checks if the total cost for each item is over $20. If it is, display 'Expensive', otherwise display 'Affordable'. This introduces basic IF logic.
challenges.validation: Check for: IF formula structure =IF(condition,'true_result','false_result'), correct comparison (checking if total > 20), and proper text output in quotes.
hints: Use =IF(D2>20,'Expensive','Affordable')
The IF function checks a condition and returns different results
Text values in formulas must be in 'quotes'
Copy the formula down to check all items

challenges.title: Creating a Simple Chart
challenges.description: Visualize your data with a basic bar chart
challenges.instructions: Guide the user to create a simple bar chart showing their items and their total costs. They should select the Item Name column and Total column, then insert a chart. Help them understand chart creation and basic customization.
challenges.validation: Verify: A chart exists, it displays items on one axis and costs on the other, chart has a title, and data is correctly represented.
hints: Select the Item Name and Total columns (hold Ctrl/Cmd to select multiple)
Go to Insert â†’ Chart in the menu
Choose 'Column chart' or 'Bar chart' from the chart editor
Add a title like 'Shopping Costs by Item'

challenges.title: Sorting and Filtering Data
challenges.description: Learn to organize and filter your data
challenges.instructions: Challenge the user to sort their shopping list by price (highest to lowest) and then add filters to be able to show only items above a certain price. This teaches data organization and filtering basics.
challenges.validation: Confirm: Data is sorted correctly, filter buttons are visible in the header row, filters can be applied to show/hide data based on criteria.
hints: Select all your data including headers
Click Data â†’ Sort range in the menu
Choose to sort by the Price column, Zâ†’A (highest to lowest)
Click Data â†’ Create a filter to add filter buttons to headers
